paper_abstract: The standard quadratic optimization problem (StQP) refers to the problem of minimizing a quadratic form over the standard simplex. Such a problem arises from numerous applications and is known to be NP-hard. In this paper we focus on a special scenario of the StQP where all the elements of the data matrix Q are independently identically distributed and follow a certain distribution such as uniform or exponential distribution. We show that the probability that such a random StQP has a global optimal solution with k nonzero elements decays exponentially in k. Numerical evaluation of our theoretical finding is discussed as well.
paper_title: Sparse solutions to random standard quadratic optimization problems
